elements.content:
Occasionally, things go wrong when conducting business. Goods fail to get delivered on time, billing errors occur, or products fail to perform as expected. Such problems need to be dealt with to retain customer goodwill. Below is a template to write a follow-up letter/email that can help to resolve a business problem:

Template to Write a Follow-up Letter/Email

1. Open with agreement.

  • You have every right to expect…

2. Offer a sincere apology.

  • Please accept our sincere apologies for…
  • We’re genuinely sorry about…

3. Explain what caused the problem.

  • The error was a result of...

4. Explain how the problem has been resolved.

  • The problem has been taken care of...

5. Promise to prevent the problem from recurring.

  • I can assure you that we are taking every action necessary to prevent this from happening again.

6. Close with something positive.

  • Thank you for giving us an opportunity to re-examine our...
  • We are always looking for ways to better our service, and your feedback is an invaluable part of that process.

While emails are the quickest way to resolve a business problem, sometimes it is necessary to send out a follow-up letter. Letters are also necessary to (a) establish a record of the incident, and (b) to formally confirm follow-up action(s). Such letters are also handy when personal contact is difficult or impossible.
Use the template you just reviewed to order the draft of a follow-up email that Champions Swim Academy (CSA) needs to send to its customers to resolve a business problem.

Saying ‘thank you’ or providing an update on a previous request are critical pieces of workplace social network etiquette. Etiquette is a code of behavior according to established norms. If you posted a question to ask for help or assistance, make sure to close the loop once your question has been answered. Closing the loop, which means to follow up or to check in to end the conversation by saying thank you or by providing an update on a previous request, recognizes the time and effort others took to respond to your post.

Review the expressions you can use (depending on the context) to say thank you and close the loop:

Thank you/Thank you so much.
I really want to thank you for your help/the guidance.
I couldn’t have done it without you/all of you.
I really appreciate everyone’s suggestions.
I’m grateful for your help/everyone’s help.
I owe you one.
I appreciate the feedback.
I’m grateful for the assistance.
Close the loop by building a ‘thank you’ statement.

Zhi Ruo: Does anyone know how I can find total time spent by a user in our livestreamed virtual classrooms?

Scott Poirot: Look under user reports.

Zhi Ruo: ! , @Scott Poirot.

Kate Brenner: When is the new corporate template debuting?

Marco Lopez: Team in Buenos Aires, the corporate template, complete with an introduction to our company, problems we solve, services and solutions, references, awards, etc., is ready and you can find it at the embedded link.

Kate Brenner: , , .
On behalf of the Team in Bueno Aires

Dan Svensson: When is the launch of the new internal HR tool?

Ravi Gupta: We will be previewing the new HR tool at the next open forum and will be launching it right after. Let us know if you have any questions about the tool you would like addressed.

Dan Svensson: . '!

Adithi Ram: If you have some time please fill out the feedback form on my presentation.

Amer Riaz: I already did. Kudos for a fabulous presentation on sales methodology. Wonderful job!

Adithi Ram: ! .

Julia Alvarez: Does anyone have any user data to share about the social media icons on our website?

Sven Vassel: We are finding a lot of issues with social media icons placed on our website. Users cannot access them if their company blocks those social media sites. I recommend we either remove them or move them to the bottom of the page.

Julia Alvarez: , , . , .

An enterprise (or workplace) social network is social media for businesses and companies. It is designed to provide a private, manageable, and secure online space for encouraging talk, discussion, and collaboration between employees within a given organization. Below is a short list of some key terms/words that can help you get familiar with its workings:

NOUNS

comment: an answer, response or reaction to a message on a social network

follower: a person who subscribes to your social media account to receive your updates

hashtag: a word or phrase preceded by a "#" (i.e. #InboundMarketing) to tag and categorize information and make it easily searchable for users

news feed: a constantly updating list of news, events, pictures, and posts from people a user follows on social media

thread: the original post plus all the comments and likes that accompany the post

emoticon: a pictorial representation of a facial expression used in writing to help the reader know the writer’s emotions

social media: a collection of online communication channels encouraging talk and the sharing of information between users

social networking: socializing in an online community

tag: a social media functionality that lets users link back to a user (v. tagging)

troll: a person who provokes a reaction, disrupts conversation, or creates controversy in an online setting (v. trolling)


ADJECTIVES

trending: extremely popular in the current moment on social media

viral: something is viral (or goes viral) when a lot of people have seen the content and shared it with other people
Use the vocabulary words from the list you just reviewed to complete each sentence.
You need an active work email address to join Grizzle. The app allows between employees who join it.
To keep my tidy, I only subscribe to things I really care about.
You need to start a new since the discussion has moved from big data to sales.
The behind-the-scenes video of the product launch went on the company’s social networking site.
Peter was fired for his unprofessional behavior on the company’s social networking site. He was constantly ­people and posting off-topic messages.
Over the course of the week, hundreds of posts collected on the company’s social networking site under the #CorporateLifeAtSymmons.
